CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Indeed , DPP - based conjugated polymers have achieved impressive PCEs up to 9% by the combination of DPP and various electron - donating building blocks.

Let's think step by step.

1. DPP - based conjugated polymers

"Material Name" entities refer to the names of materials mentioned in the given paragraph. In this case, the material name is "DPP-based conjugated polymers." DPP stands for diketopyrrolopyrrole, which is a common electron-deficient building block used in organic photovoltaic materials. The phrase "conjugated polymers" refers to a class of materials with alternating single and double bonds, which are often used in optoelectronic applications due to their excellent charge transport properties. Therefore, "DPP-based conjugated polymers" refer to a specific type of material that is made by combining DPP with other electron-donating building blocks to create a polymer with conjugated electronic structure.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. DPP-based conjugated polymers

After removing irrelevant entities, we are left with only one material name in the paragraph, which is "DPP-based conjugated polymers." This material name clearly refers to a specific type of polymeric material that is made by combining DPP with other electron-donating building blocks to create a polymer with conjugated electronic structure.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PV.content:

Paragraph: Indeed , DPP - based conjugated polymers have achieved impressive PCEs up to 9% by the combination of DPP and various electron - donating building blocks.

1. DPP (Diketopyrrolopyrrole)
2. various electron-donating building blocks

These are the "Property Value" entities in the given paragraph. DPP and various electron-donating building blocks are the components that have contributed to the impressive power conversion efficiencies (PCEs) of up to 9% in DPP-based conjugated polymers.

1. 9% (Power conversion efficiencies)

This is the only entity that clearly refers to the Value of Material Property in the given paragraph. The value 9% represents the power conversion efficiencies (PCEs) achieved by DPP-based conjugated polymers.
